isis.stitle: TSI 08-12-10 - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - New Injection Control Pressure (ICP) Test

subjectgroup.subject: Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - New Injection Control Pressure (ICP) Test

geninfo.para: Refer to the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual as follows:

item.para: EGES-270 International® DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Engine Diagnostic Manual
EGES-370 International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9, and 10 Engine Diagnostic Manual

geninfo.para: The new test replaces the current Low ICP System Pressure Test as outlined in "Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics" section of the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual.
Use the following procedures for all hard start and no start ICP service issues.

note.para: Injection control pressure during cranking should be at least 6 MPa (870 psi)/1.2V for the engine to start. During these procedures, 6 MPa (870 psi)/1.2V or above is the desired specification.

svcsubproc.title: Injection Control Pressure (ICP) System Test

note.para: See "Diagnostic Software Operation" section in the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual for specific Electronic Service Tool (EST) software procedures to do this test.

svcsubproc.para: The ICP System Test does the following:

item.para: Confirms proper operation of the low and high-pressure oil systems
Identifies which branch of the system (high or low) is failing to meet specifications

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service Manual or Engine Diagnostic Manual.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to ON. Do not start engine.
Open COM device.
Open KOER_Road Performance session.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, stay clear of rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Crank engine for 20 seconds minimum. Monitor Engine Oil Pressure (EOP) and ICP while cranking.
Record the EOP and ICP maximum readings obtained and time required to obtain those readings on the appropriate Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If EOP is not present, do Lube Oil System diagnostics in the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual.
If EOP is present, but ICP is 0 kPa (0 psi), remove the Engine Oil Temperature (EOT) sensor and check oil level in high-pressure oil reservoir.
If oil reservoir is full, continue with Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) Control System Test.
If oil reservoir is low or empty, inspect base lube oil system.
If EOP and ICP are present, but low, continue with IPR Control System Test.
Low or no lube oil pressure due to:
Gross external or internal oil pressure leak
Low or no injection control pressure (more tests required)

svcsubproc.title: Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) Control System Test

note.para: See "Diagnostic Software Operation" section in Engine Diagnostic Manualfor specific Electronic Service Tool (EST) software procedures to do this test.

svcsubproc.para: To check for proper Injection Control Pressure (ICP) system operation.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service Manual or Engine Diagnostic Manual.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to ON. Do not start engine.
Open COM device.
Open KOER_RoadPerformance session.
Remove IPR harness connection.
Inspect for connection problems.
Record connection problems on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If connection appears intact, continue to next step.
If connection is unacceptable, repair as required. Repeat test again to validate repair.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) breakout tee

step1.para: Connect the IPR Breakout Tee to the IPR valve.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) Breakout Tee B+ lead
Figure 3. Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) Breakout Tee ground lead

note.para: Connecting the IPR Breakout Tee to the IPR valve and engine harness will result in blown fuses when applying B+ and ground.

step1.para: Connect IPR Breakout Tee to B+ and ground.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, stay clear of rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Crank the engine for 20 seconds minimum.
Record the ICP maximum reading obtained on the appropriate Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If reading is not within specification, continue to the next test.
If reading is within specification, correct IPR circuits using the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual. Test again to validate repair.

svcsubproc.title: High-pressure Oil Pump Test

note.para: See "Diagnostic Software Operation" section in Engine Diagnostic Manual for specific Electronic Service Tool (EST) software procedures to do this test.

svcsubproc.para: To check high-pressure pump and Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) for inability to reach maximum injection control pressure

item.para: Injection Control Pressure (ICP) test sensor: Use part number 1875784C91 - on diesel engines beginning with the 2007 Model Year (S/N 3000001 and up). Use part number 1845536C91 - on diesel engines starting with the 2006 Model Year and older (S/N 2999999 and down).

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service Manual or Engine Diagnostic Manual.

step1.para: Retain IPR Breakout Tee with B+ and ground connections from previous test.
Remove high-pressure hose from the cylinder head fitting.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Injection Control Pressure (ICP) adapter tools and test ICP sensor

step1.para: Install ICP adapter tools and test ICP sensor.
Disconnect Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) sensor.
Install pressure sensor breakout harness to engine harness - MAP sensor connector.
Route and connect breakout harness to the test ICP sensor.
Use a Digital Multimeter (DMM) to monitor test ICP sensor signal voltage.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, stay clear of rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Crank engine for a minimum of 20 seconds.
Record the ICP test sensor voltage/pressure on the appropriate Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If ICP reading is not within specification, continue to IPR Block-Off Test.
If ICP reading is within specification, do the High-pressure Oil Rail Leak Test .

svcsubproc.title: Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) Block-Off Test

note.para: See "Diagnostic Software Operation" in Engine Diagnostic Manual for specific Electronic Service Tool (EST) software procedures to do this test.

svcsubproc.para: To check high-pressure pump for ability to reach maximum injection control pressure.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service Manual or Engine Diagnostic Manual.

step1.para: Retain setup and adapter tools from previous test except for IPR setup.

note.para: If engine is equipped with an air compressor, a compressor cylinder head bolt may interfere with the IPR removal. If this occurs, it is acceptable to break the connector on the IPR valve to provide clearance. Do not remove the air compressor cylinder head bolt from the air compressor.

step1.para: Remove IPR valve from high-pressure oil pump. Inspect seals on IPR for damage. If damaged, reseal IPR valve and retest.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) block-off tool
Figure 7. Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) block-off tool installed

step1.para: Install IPR block-off tool.

note.para: Inspect O-rings on IPR isolation adapter. If O-rings are damaged or missing, replace O-rings from kit 1842615C92. Backup O-rings in kit are not used for tool.

step1.para: Use Digital Multimeter (DMM) to monitor ICP sensor signal voltage.

note.para: ICP sensor signal voltage/pressure can also be monitored by the diagnostic software by connecting the breakout tee to the engine harness Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) sensor.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, stay clear of rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Crank engine for 20 seconds minimum.
Record the ICP sensor voltage on the appropriate Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If results are not within specification, replace the high-pressure pump.
If results are within specification, replace the IPR valve. Repeat test to validate repair.

svcsubproc.title: High-pressure Oil Rail Leak Test
svcsubproc.para: To check for high-pressure oil rail leaks under the valve cover.

item.para: Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) block-off tool ZTSE4816

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service Manual or Engine Diagnostic Manual.

step1.para: Retain setup, adapter tools, and IPR block-off tool from previous test.
Install the high-pressure hose to the cylinder head.
Remove engine vale cover following procedure in Engine Service Manual.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, stay clear of rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Crank engine for a minimum of 20 seconds.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Injector oil inlet adapter installed in high-pressure oil rail

step1.para: Inspect the high-pressure oil rail to injector adapter for excessive leaks while cranking the engine.
Record the results on the appropriate Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If no leaks are found, do Injection Control Pressure (ICP) Unplugged Test .

If leaks are found, remove high-pressure oil rail assembly following the procedure in either the EGES 265-1 Engine Service Manual for the DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 diesel engines or EGES 335 Engine Service Manual for the International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9, and 10 diesel engines. Inspect and repair as required. See Inspection and Repair of High-pressure Oil Rail (page 11). Repeat test to validate repair.
High-pressure oil rail supply O-ring leak
Porous or cracked high-pressure oil rail
Fuel injector adapter (injector puck) O-ring leak

svcsubproc.title: Injection Control Pressure (ICP) Unplugged Test
svcsubproc.para: To check for biased ICP sensor or sensor circuit problem.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service Manual or Engine Diagnostic Manual.

step1.para: Install Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) and engine harness.
Leave valve cover removed from previous test.
Unplug ICP sensor from engine harness.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, stay clear of rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Crank engine for a minimum of 20 seconds. If engine starts, see ICP Sensor in "Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics" section of the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual or replace biased ICP sensor.

svcsubproc.title: Inspection and Repair of High-pressure Oil Rail
svcsubproc.para: To identify source of leak at the high-pressure oil rail assembly.

note.para: High-pressure oil rail components are available as service parts. Do not replace a complete oil rail for component failures.

step1.para: Remove high-pressure oil rail assembly following the procedure in Engine Service Manual.

figure.caption: Figure 9. O-ring for high-pressure oil manifold

step1.para: Inspect oil inlet O-ring. Record condition on the appropriate Diagnostic Form and replace as necessary.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Injector oil inlet adapter installed in high-pressure oil rail

step1.para: Inspect injector oil inlet adapter back up rings and injector oil inlet seals. Record condition on the appropriate Diagnostic Form and replace as necessary.

Inspect oil outlet tubes for a protruding internal seal at the base of the tube. This internal O-ring is not serviceable. If the internal O-ring is leaking or protruding, replace the complete injector oil inlet adapter.
Inspect oil rail body for cracks.

item.para: Damaged injector oil inlet adapter seals
High-pressure oil rail assembly not seated correctly
High-pressure oil rail assembly installed using incorrect bolt torque

note.para: Use clean engine oil to assist in installation of the seals, and when assembling the oil rail to the cylinder head. This reduces the chance of seal roll or damage to the seals.

During installation of the high-pressure oil rail, take care to align all six oil inlet adapters into the injectors without distorting or tearing the injector-to-adapter seals. The high-pressure oil rail should seat against the surface of the cylinder head. To assist in the installation of the oil rail, use two mounting bolts as guides and gently rock the oil rail into place. Never draw the high-pressure oil rail into place with mounting bolts. If alignment is not achieved, the inlet adapters can unseat internally and leak at the oil inlet tube. Additional failure of an injector, adapter or bolt can occur.

step1.para: Install high-pressure oil rail assembly following the procedure in Engine Service Manual.

note.para: The following figures (11-14) are a typical High-pressure Oil Rail with Engine Brake. The oil rail being repaired may not consist of all components. See breakdown below for parts required.
Part numbers subject to change. Refer to parts catalog for number updates.

specpara.para: High-pressure Oil Rail Seals Kit 1842626C94 includes:

figure.caption: Figure 11. High-pressure oil rail exploded view (International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9, and 10 diesel engines with brake)
Figure 12. High-pressure oil rail exploded view (International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9, and 10 diesel engines without brake)
Figure 13. High-pressure oil rail exploded view (International® DT 466, DT 570, and HT570 EGR engines without brake)
Figure 14. High-pressure oil rail exploded view (International® DT 466, DT 570, & HT 570 EGR engines with brake)
